Detailed Description

BtDeviceListReverseIterator is used to iterate a BtDeviceList in the reverse order. Dereferencing the iterator returns pointers or references to objects. So these objects can be changed through this iterator.

Member Function Documentation

BtDevice & BtDeviceListReverseIterator::operator * (   ) 
 

iterator dereference operator

operator* returns a reference to a BtDevice, which is located at the position the iterator represents. The expression (*i).operation(...)</code) and the expression i->operation(...) behave identically.

Returns:
A reference to a BtDevice at the current location.

BtDeviceListReverseIterator BtDeviceListReverseIterator::operator++ (  int   ) 
 

iterator increment operator (postfix)

operator++ is the postfix increment operator and is used to move the current position that the iterator is representing in a BtDeviceList forward to the next position in the list. Incrementing the position of a reverse iterator is the same as decrementing the position in a normal iterator.

Returns:
A BtDeviceListReverseIterator that is representing the iterator before advancing. The iterator itself is either the next position in the BtDeviceList or the past-the-end iterator

Reimplemented from BtDeviceListConstantReverseIterator.

BtDeviceListReverseIterator & BtDeviceListReverseIterator::operator++ (   ) 
 

iterator increment operator (praefix)

operator++ is the prefix increment operator and is used to move the current position that the iterator is representing in a BtDeviceList forward to the next position in the list. Incrementing the position of a reverse iterator is the same as decrementing the position in a normal iterator.

Returns:
A reference to a BtDeviceListReverseIterator that is either representing the iterator to the next position in the BtDeviceList or the past-the-end iterator.

Reimplemented from BtDeviceListConstantReverseIterator.

BtDeviceListReverseIterator BtDeviceListReverseIterator::operator-- (  int   ) 
 

iterator decrement operator (postfix)

operator-- is the postfix decrement operator and is used to move the current position that the iterator is representing in a BtDeviceList backward to the previous position in the list. Decrementing the position of a reverse iterator is the same as decrementing the position in a normal iterator.

Returns:
A BtDeviceListReverseIterator that is representing the iterator before receding. The iterator itself is either the previous position in the BtDeviceList or the past-the-end iterator.

Reimplemented from BtDeviceListConstantReverseIterator.

BtDeviceListReverseIterator & BtDeviceListReverseIterator::operator-- (   ) 
 

iterator decrement operator (praefix)

operator-- is the prefix decrement operator and is used to move the current position that the iterator is representing in a BtDeviceList backward to the previous position in the list. Decrementing the position of a reverse iterator is the same as decrementing the position in a normal iterator.

Returns:
A reference to a BtDeviceListReverseIterator that is either representing the iterator to the previous position in the BtDeviceList or the past-the-end iterator.

Reimplemented from BtDeviceListConstantReverseIterator.

BtDevice * BtDeviceListReverseIterator::operator-> (   ) 
 

iterator indirection operator

operator-> returns a pointer to a BtDevice, which is located at the position the iterator represents. The expression (*i).operation(...) and the expression i->operation(...) behave identically.

Returns:
A pointer to a BtDevice at the current location.
